pages.text: The $(item)Solar Purifier$() is a simple multiblock that uses the sun to evaporate and collect $(water)Purified Water$().$(br2)While much slower than more active forms of filtration, the $(item)Solar Purifier$() benefits from being a passive low-cost form of purification.$(br2)To form the multiblock, first place two $(item)Open Barrels$() next to

one another with their sides touching ensuring at least one barrel has clear line of sight to the sky.$(br2)Next, fill the barrel that can see the sky with $(water)Water$() while leaving the second barrel empty.$(br2)Finally, place a $(l:open_barrel/barrel_lid)Barrel Lid$() on top of both barrels, ensuring that the $(item)Open Barrel$() filled with water is covered by a $(item)Solar Collector Barrel Lid$().

If constructed correctly, the water will slowly evaporate and fill the empty barrel with $(water)Purified Water$(). Failing to cover a barrel will result in the evaporated water escaping, which can be seen by small steam clouds occasionally escaping the barrel.$(br2)Additionally, the biome the multiblock is placed in will influence the process, increasing or decreasing the speed by Â±20% based on the biome temperature.
